results.title: Of mice and men
results.creator_credit: Gary Sinise, Russ Smith and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: John Malkovich and Gary Sinise both deliver powerhouse performances in this adaptation of John Steinbeck’s classic tale of doomed friendship set in the Great Depression. Best friends Lennie (Malkovich) and George (Sinise) find themselves unemployed and unable to keep stable employment for long, due to Lennie’s infantile mental capacity. Their luck seems to change as they are hired at the Tyler Ranch, although they must endure the over-zealous supervision by the boss’s son, Curley (Casey Siemaszko). After settling in and making friends, their world is torn asunder by tragedy when Curley’s unhappy wife (Sherilyn Fenn) becomes the innocent victim of Lennie’s compassion.

results.title: Dark angel
results.creator_credit: Robert Iscove, Elisa Kohn Taub, Big Ticket Television and Spelling Entertainment
results.brief_description: In this made-for-television action thriller, a homicide detective who has been transferred from the Baton Rouge police department to New Orleans under mysterious circumstances is linked to a serial killer who preys on adulterous women. His new superiors assign a female detective to investigate him forcing him to confront his past in order to prove himself innocent before more women are killed. Cast includes Eric Roberts, Ashley Crow, Gina Torres, Linden Ashby.

results.title: Jonathan Livingston seagull
results.creator_credit: Hall Bartlett, JLS Partnership and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Richard Bach’s best selling novel about spiritual development and human achievement is brought to life in this rendition, complete with a Neil Diamond soundtrack. The story begins with a flock of seagulls pecking at garbage left by a boat. One of these seagulls - Jonathan (voice supplied by James Franciscus), longs to soar above his current existence, reaching dizzying heights and be the fastest seagull. Thus he leaves the flock to see the world and in search of speed. On reaching aviary heaven he meets Maureen Seagull (voice supplied by Juliet Mills) who introduces Jonathan to new experiences. Jonathan returns to his flock with new found knowledge but the other seagulls are sceptical until he performs a miracle and Jonathan is elevated to a messianic hero. Voices also supplied by Philip Ahn, Richard Crenna, Kelly Harmon and Hal Holbrook.

results.title: The Sweet hereafter
results.creator_credit: Atom Egoyan, Camelia Frieberg, Ego Film Arts and Alliance
results.brief_description: In a small mountain town a lawyer (Ian Holm) arrives to argue that the parents of children killed in a horrific bus accident should claim compensation for the tragedy. The lawyer himself is dealing with his own daughter’s heroin addiction and his inability to assist her. As this wonderful and intelligent film unfolds, we as an audience are led to explore issues of familial and personal responsibility, in particular the difficult searing question of what it means to be parent to a child. We are also asked to question our culture’s increasing fear and terror of accident and death. Filmed in glorious Canadian wilderness in the middle of heavy winter, “The Sweet Hereafter” is a masterful film: script, cinematography and acting are nearly faultless. Egoyan has consistently been proving himself to be one of the most challenging, exciting and experimental of film directors working in cinema since the 1980s. This assured classical film is both a departure and a culmination of his work: his films have all explored the alienation and loneliness of our contemporary world and our increasing estrangement from family and each other. It is no exaggeration to call this film one of the most emotionally and intellectually profound films of modern cinema. Based on a novel by Russell Banks. Cast includes Sarah Polley, Maury Chaykin, Peter Donaldson, Bruce Greenwood and Arsinee Khanjian.

results.title: Gods and monsters
results.creator_credit: Bill Condon, Mark R. Harris, Gregg Fienberg, Paul Colichman, Regent Entertainment, BBC Film Unit and Flashpoint Pictures
results.brief_description: Gods and Monsters is a biography of film director James Whale who created one of the screen’s great mythic heroes in the classic version of “Frankenstein”. Beginning in the 1950s when Whale (Ian McKellen) is largely forgotten or only remembered through camp nostalgia, the film traces Whale’s increasing obsession with his gardener, Clayton (Brendan Fraser). As Whale’s health deteriorates, his memory increasingly draws him back to the pivotal moments of his life: his rejection of his harsh working-class youth; his service in World War I and his loving affair with a fellow soldier; and his years directing in the classic Hollywood era. Combining biography and a mature examination of the possible love between homosexual and heterosexual men, “Gods and Monsters” ends up being a loving tribute to both the classic Hollywood era and the possibility of transcendence for working-class people. Based on the book “Father of Frankenstein” by Christopher Bram. Cast includes Ian McKellen, Brendan Fraser and Lynn Redgrave. (Awards: Winner of the 1998 Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay)

results.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Rappeneau, Michel Seydoux, Rene Cleitman, D D Productions, Camera One, Hachette Premiere and UGC Images
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Edmond Rostand, this lavish version of the classic French romance comedy combines the breathtaking wit and poetry of the play with the colour and spectacle of a good costume drama. Gerard Depardieu is perfect as the charismatic Cyrano, whose enormous nose makes him feel unworthy to love his cousin Roxanne (Anne Brochet). When Roxanne confesses her love for handsome young cadet Christian de Neuvillette (Vincent Perez), Cyrano becomes a reluctant conduit for his love when he becomes the ‘voice’ for the inarticulate Christian. Soon Roxanne has fallen in love with Christian’s handsome looks, but also with the passionate poetry of his soul, which she doesn’t realise is Cyrano. In French with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of 1991 Academy Award for Best Costume Design and 1991 Golden Globe for Best Foreign Film)

results.title: I Know what you did last summer
results.creator_credit: Jim Gillespie, Stokely Chaffin, Eric Feig, Neal H. Moritz and Mandalay Entertainment
results.brief_description: Following their graduation, friends Julie, Helen, Ray and Barry get into Barry’s new BMW and head for the beach to celebrate the end of an important chapter in their lives. This sudden decision leads them on a path which will change their lives inexorably when they accidentally hit a pedestrian on deserted road. After the initial shock of what has happened has abated, they decide to toss the evidence, his body- into the ocean and swear secrecy to the event ever taking place. A year passes, the friendships have deteriorated, and strange things begin to happen. An anonymous note saying “I know what you did last summer” brings the accident on the road to life again, forcing the four friends to wonder whether someone has broken the promise of secrecy, or whether there was someone else on the road that day. Based on the novel by Lois Duncan. Screenplay by Kevin Williamson. Cast includes Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr, and Anne Heche.

results.title: The Longest day
results.creator_credit: Gerd Oswald, Bernhard Wicki, Ken Annakin, Andrew Marton, Darryl F. Zanuck, Darryl F Zanuck Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Cornelius Ryan’s compilation of interviews with D Day survivors, the film is broken into three sections- the Allied preparations for invasion, a faithful recreation of the movement of an Armada across the English Channel, and culminating in the attack on Normandy beaches. Intercut with these sequences is the response by German soldiers which are subtitled and directed by Bernhard Wicki. One of the most ambitious war films ever made, ‘The Longest day’ features 48 international stars, 4 directors, and won 2 Academy Awards for Special Effects and Cinematography, and was nominated for Best Picture.

results.title: Midnight in the garden of good and evil
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Arnold Stiefel and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood directed this adaptation of John Berendt’s non-fiction best-seller about a Savannah, Georgia, murder case. As the film begins, New York journalist, John Kelso (John Cusack), arrives in Savannah to do a brief article on the annual Christmas party given by sophisticated, urbane antique dealer, Jim Williams (Kevin Spacey). After the party, Williams kills his violent lover, Billy, explaining it as self defence. Kelso decides to stay in Savannah to cover the trial, encountering a variety of colourful locals and eccentrics. Cast includes Kevin Spacey, John Cusack, Jack Thompson, Alison Eastwood and Jude Law.

results.title: Radiance
results.creator_credit: Rachel Perkins, Andrew Myer, Ned Lander and Eclipse Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Three sisters are reunited after the death of their mother; their lifestyles a world apart from each other. Eldest sister Cressy (Rachael Maza), has found success as a classical singer and rejected her past life to pursue a career overseas. Middle daughter Mae (Trisha Morton-Thomas) resents Cressy’s success and feels bitter at being the one whose had to stay behind to care for their senile mother. Youngest sister Nona (Deborah Mailman), is vibrant, sexually promiscuous, pregnant, and unlike her sisters, loyal to the memory of their mother. In the brief time the sisters spend together, they learn the painful memories and secrets that has distanced them from one another, and as the family’s intrigue is revealed the sisters can finally unite together.
